name: Gemini Hackathon Readiness Arena (Fast)
description: Goal-focused arena: judge evaluates ONLY whether this is ready to submit/demo for a Gemini hackathon-style event.
safety: anything involving children must be framed as monitoring/assistance only, not autonomous care

objective.thesis: Assess whether the idea is hackathon-ready: a clear demo, a tight story, and a credible 48–72h build plan that showcases Gemini well.
successDefinition: Problem + user are clear in one sentence
Demo flow is concrete (what the user does + what the app shows)
Gemini usage is essential (not decorative) and explained simply
A credible 48–72h build plan exists (MVP scope + risks + mitigations)
Submission pitch is crisp: one-liner + differentiator + why-now
Safety and responsible-use boundaries are stated when relevant

scoreGuidance.9_10: Ready: crisp demo + clear Gemini role + credible build plan; minimal risk.
scoreGuidance.7_8: Nearly ready: one key gap (demo ambiguity, Gemini role, or scope) remains.
scoreGuidance.5_6: Not ready: too vague or scope too big; Gemini role unclear; plan missing.
scoreGuidance.0_4: Confusing or unsafe; cannot demo credibly in hackathon timeframe.

discovery.label: Discovery
discovery.goal: Clarify the idea with friendly precision.

interrogation.label: Pressure-test
interrogation.goal: Force concrete demo + build plan details.

bannedPhrases: what budget does it come from

judges.label: Host
judges.tone: impatient but helpful; wants crisp answers

criteriaConfig.description: Demo is concrete: what the user does and what the app shows.
questionStarters: Describe the demo in 5 steps: user action → screen/output each step.

criteriaConfig.description: Gemini is essential (core capability) and clearly described.
questionStarters: Where exactly does Gemini sit in the loop, and what output does it generate that you cannot fake?

criteriaConfig.description: Credible 48–72h build plan: MVP scope, sequencing, and a risk mitigation.
questionStarters: What will you build in the next 48 hours (3 milestones), and what’s the biggest risk plus mitigation?

criteriaConfig.description: One-liner and differentiator are crisp; clear why-now.
questionStarters: Give me a one-liner and one differentiator that a judge would remember.

criteriaConfig.description: Scope is realistic; can name what is explicitly cut for hackathon.
questionStarters: Name 3 things you will NOT build for the hackathon version, to keep it demoable.

criteriaConfig.description: States responsible-use boundary if the domain is sensitive.
questionStarters: What is one safety boundary you will enforce in the demo to avoid harmful misuse?

judges.label: Product Judge
judges.tone: supportive, practical, slightly impatient with vagueness

criteriaConfig.description: Pin down the real moment of use (trigger + context).
questionStarters: What happened right before someone uses this the first time?
What is the exact moment they decide they need this?

criteriaConfig.description: Make the job-to-be-done and outcome concrete.
questionStarters: After one use, what changed for the user in a way they can describe?
What would a user say they got out of this (in their words)?

criteriaConfig.description: Define the trust boundary: what you do vs what the user verifies.
questionStarters: What is the biggest trust failure that would make a user quit instantly?
Where do you draw the line between automate vs verify?

criteriaConfig.description: Explain why the user returns naturally.
questionStarters: Why do they come back a second time instead of moving on?
What changes week-to-week that keeps this useful?

criteriaConfig.description: Define the smallest complete v1 that still proves value.
questionStarters: What is the smallest complete v1 that still feels useful?
What is the first end-to-end slice you can ship in 2 weeks?
